Mostly we had this facility to…

title: Great Place to Stay
review: I stayed in this hotel in October 2012. first time in Italy what a lovely country. The first time to stay in a family ran hotel. Usually stay in named hotel; but after staying in a family hotel  I would go back again. Everybody was so helpful; everyone took great pride in they work and could not do enough for you. i could not recommend this hotel eough. If you want to stay in a friendly family run hotel try this hotel. The food was really good; great nights sleep just perfect.

title: Gem of a family hotel
review: Had a wonderful stay at the Piccolo , from the cleaners to the owners all the staff are wonderful. Rooms spotless, food was good and the attention to the guests is from a bygone age. We loved it.  Newmarket Holidays from Inverness , airline was OK no problems (and I was worried after reading write ups)  Transfers fine, on our return journey we had to leave our hotel earlier than expected as road was closed due to marathon and we had expected to spend a long wait at airport, our rep thought of taking us to a shopping centre and we spend a couple of hours looking at lovely shops and having coffee etc. this was a nice surprise as Verona airport is not the largest , well done Newmarket rep.  A lovely autumn break. Thanks you to the Cheisa family. S Townsley

title: Interesting Unique and Very Good
review: A hotel and mangement team led by the owner who offer an old fashioned service that you don't often see nowadays. The welcome at reception was very warm and the staff were very friendly, the facilities of the hotel were a little lacking and could have been enhanced with an area outdoors to enjoy a drink in the evening. The entertainment was poor and glad to say it only happened twice in a 9 day stay, the food was very good and good qulity wine was avilable t reasonable prices. Could have done with some tea/coffee making facilities in the room but overall impressed and would recommend

title: Maire M
review: We really enjoyed our stay in this excellent hotel. Service was brilliant. The staff and owner were extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. Accomodation was great and evervthing was spotless. Food was excellent. A great holiday.I would reccomend this hotel highly and would like to  return.

title: September holiday September 2012
review: The level of service was excellent, all staff very helpful and polite. The owner Mr. Chiesa was always on hand and applied a high level of personal care and attention to each guest to provide a service reminiscent of a bygone era.  Food was excellent!!  The free bikes were a real bonus, making it easy to get around the whole of the Alto Garda, Riva, Arco, Dro etc.  All in all an excellent hotel.  All round a

title: David s
review: My Wife and i have just returned From a Newmarket Holiday to Lake Garda staying at Torbole at the hotel Piccolo Monda which was excellant the the food and the service was briliant. Also the friendly staff just couldnt do enough for you  also the hotel was allways spotless The only fault of the holiday was the long coach trip of nearly three hours from Bergan airport why Newmarket Travel dont use Veroa Airport .The organized tours were great and saw lots of lovely places highly reccomend

title: Absolutely lovely hotel in the most beautiful location!
review: As I had been scouring trip advisor for reviews in the weeks running up to our stay at the Piccolo Mondo Hotel, I thought it was only fair that I offer my own review now that I have returned.  Piccolo Mondo Hotel is a family run, 4 star hotel situated in the northern Lake Garda town of Torbole. Immediately, as soon as we walked through the doors, we were joyfully and warmly welcomed by the receptionist, Monica. Although it was late (about 9.45pm) she quickly checked us in and asked if we wanted to sit down for a meal - which we did.   Now, the food. If I have to be honest I was a little concerned reading some of the previous reviews, particularly concerning choice and portion sizes. But unless you have decided that you are in Italy and therefore must eat a whole pizza every…

title: Holiday on Lake Garda.
review: My wife and I and two friends have just returned from a holiday on Lake Garda which was organised by Newmarket Travel. We were based at the Piccolo Mondo Hotel and from there visited Venice, Verona and the Dolomites all of which were excellent and very interesting.The only thing that marred our trip was the long coach trip to and from the hotel and I would recommend that anybody doing this trip makes sure that they fly to Verona even though it may be a bit further from your home, as an extra hour spent travelling in the Uk could mean saving three hours in Italy! The hotel was very good with excellent rooms and very pleasant staff at all times.My only criticism was the lack of choice in the evening meals but this could be overcome by requesting an alternative with the waiters.The…

title: Piccolo Mondo Hotel
review: We had a great holiday in Torbole located at the top of Lake Garda. The scenery was magnificent  and it is easy to visit other towns by ferry or bus. The hotel staff were very friendly especially Patricio who could also be very funny. The food and service were also excellent as was our room.  The area is great for windsurfers, cyclists and walkers. You can walk to Riva del Garda quite easily in an hour. Highly recommended.

title: wonderful holiday
review: We had a wonderful holiday here in July. Everything was lovely. We were pleased with our room (even though the view from the balcony wasn't great). The food was excellent and the head waiter, Patricio, was exceptional. He recommended which meals my husband could eat (he can't eat onions or garlic) and went out of his way to give the very best of service! All the staff were very good with the exception of the owner's son when he was on duty. The customer service we had from him was not so good which is a pity because otherwise the rating would have been five stars.Overall, it was a great place to stay and I highly recommend it.

title: Excellent family run hotel, super staff, traditional excellent food.
review: Had a wonderful week here, beautiful location at the top of the lake, stunning mountains surrounding. Highly recommended. Ideal for families, people looking for relaxation also great for road cyclists. Very popular for cycling. The hotel chef worked for the Italian national cycling team. Beautiful pool both indoor and outdoor.

title: Very nice meal
review: Visited the restaurant at the Piccolo Mondo hotel even though we were not staying there and had a lovely experience. The waiter was very enthusiastic about the food and gave some great recommendations.  Although the restaurant does not have a lake view there is a good atmosphere.  The food was very good- in particular the beef which was marinated in a delicious berry sauce. The puddings were slightly disappointing as the tiramisu had way too much chocolate powder which slightly unbalanced the dish.   Overall it was a very positive experience and would recommend to other diners!

title: Attention to detail very important at this hotel
review: Arriving quite late and tired we were met by friendly ,pleasant and efficient staff.A meal was ready after we checked in and this standard of service was maintained for the duration of our holiday .The family and staff were always available if needed. We were looking forward to the food having read reviews and we were not disappointed.A varied menu ,food beautifully cooked and presented. We would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Friendliest hotel staff ever!!
review: We arrived at the hotel in a rather comedic fashion. Whilst walking up the stairs by suitcase decided to separate from the handle and bounce down the stairs. I think a lady who might be some relative on the owners laughed and made a few jokes but nothing rude/offensive. Anyway, we got to the desk and greeted by (I imagine the wife/owner) who spoke good English and shown us to our room.  The initial impression was that the room wasn't the biggest, but it had a HUGE bed, dressing table and a table with two chairs. So more than big enough! Bathrooms was clean and well furnished, although one light bulb was blown for our whole stay. tut tut. I have ready complaints about the shower, but it's OK. Just one of those that run off the tap in the bath.  The pool was great, but often empty…

title: Very welcoming hotel - great service
review: We enjoyed our stay in the Piccolo Mondo. We were welcomed by a friendly receptionist (Monica) who spoke excellent English and make us feel at home, with a porter on hand to take our bags to our room.  Our room was in the newer extended part of the hotel and was very spacious, with a good bathroom - it was all kept very clean and well looked after.  Breakfast was very good quality - plenty of choice and even a hot selection of scrambled egg and bacon and occasionally sausage. We were half board and were impressed by the evening meals - while on some nights there was not lots of options to chose from there was a good variety and enough courses and help yourself hors d'oevres that we never left the table hungry (in fact normally the opposite). There was a night of "local"…

title: Definitely worth a visit .
review: This was my second visit to the hotel and my Husbands first . The hotel is in an excellent location for walking , cycling around the northern part of the lake . You can walk along the lakeshore from Torbole to Riva which is about 1.5 miles . Ferry trips to Limone , Malcesine and Riva (all beautiful locations) are so easy to negotiate once you have mastered reading the timetable , you can hop on and off them all day . A ride up the cable car at Malcesine is a must , just try and get there early to avoid queuing . The food at the hotel had improved since my last visit ,portions may be on the small side for big eaters ?  The stairs carpet could do with replacing or cleaning , it did look rather worn or dirty . The rooms are clean but basic which is all you need as who wants to be…

title: An absolute gem
review: Just returned from a seven day stay at this hotel and cannot fault it in anyway. Superb staff, fantastic food and great rooms, added to this is the enclosed garden with a great pool. You cannot go wrong it is an absolute gem. We will definitely be returning sometime in the future.

title: absolutely fantastic experience
review: We have just come back from our honeymoon staying at The Piccolo Mondo and we couldn't have asked for a better place.  We were welcomed from the moment we stepped off our transfer coach, with a waiter rushing out to help with bags. All the staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect, not just for us but for every guest in the hotel. always smiling and asking how you were.  The rooms were comfy and clean, and the balcony had breath taking views of the mountains.  The restaurant served fantastic food, which got better with every course and a different menu every evening.  Indoor and outdoor pool were great, and sitting by the outside pool with views of the mountains all round was something you don't get elsewhere. Position of the hotel was ideal. Not too…

title: Nice hotel
review: Spent 4 days here and enjoyed the experience. The hotel is well located, next to a river and a short walk to Terbole town centre. Our room look out toward the mountains and it was a pleasure to draw the curtains each morning and take in the view. Good location for exploring the top end of Lake Garda. We had a half board package with breakfast and dinner included. The former was always good but dinner varied from good to indifferent. Not a wide choice selection. Room was good, reasonable size with good linen and towels. Bathroom was nothing special but adequate. Public rooms in hotel were good with wi Fi and Internet access. Parking is available if you have a car. Main plus point that boosted our opinion of the place was the almost universal good service from the staff. From…

title: lovely hotel
review: Just returned from a week at Piccolo Mondo which means small world. We couldnt fault it , the position of the hotel is special with a river running past and a backdrop of the mountains.Food was excellent very Italian and waiter served which we loved. Very friendly staff. If ther is a negative the showers could do with an upgrade, apart from that wonderful holiday.

title: Great place to stay at Lake Garda
review: Found this hotel by accident as the usual one I stay at was closed for the winter. Very pleased with what I found. The owner and staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were excellent and had sky tv which was an added bonus.Only stayed 1 night so did not have a chance to try the indoor pool which I looked at and thought was a good size for a proper swim. Also did not have time for an evening meal but the breakfast was good. Would definately stay again. Not sure if I could afford to stay there in peak season but over the winter the rates were very reasonable.

title: Good but basic
review: Excellent, clean & friendly. Good food although very small portions.  Ordinary house wine expensive at 20 euro a bottle .  Had to pay for table water at 2.50 euro a bottle . A very small lager  was 4.50 euros and a Bacardi & Coke  6.50 euros .  We soon found the local bars charging 80 % less !

title: Holiday
review: We went for dinner to this Hotel, we. were six (6) of us, I must say that the food was excellent and also the service. The owner Sergio took care of us and with his cooking next to our table he really did a good job and show.

title: Good food, friendly staff, worth a visit
review: Our 8-night stay was a last-minute booking and we were, to be honest, a bit wary of what sort of hotel we would find in such a popular resort at short notice.  We needn't have worried.  Almost everything about our stay was just right for us.  The room was plenty big enough with a balcony and very clean, although the shower left a lot to be desired (it was perfectly clean but leaked all over the floor, no matter what we did to avoid it).  The food was excellent quality every evening and the hotel rightly prides itself on this.  All the staff were cheerful, helpful and friendly, and did their best to make us feel welcome.  The owner himself worked alongside them in the restaurant and seemed to be around all day, every day.  The hotel is 10 minutes easy walk from the centre of…

title: super hotel
review: we recently stayed in the piccolo mondo as part of our tour. It is a family run hotel in an ideal situation.The owner was always around working along side the very hard working staff. Mohamed,the barman was indeed a really hard working member of staff with a great sense of humour. We really enjoyed our stay in Torbole & hope to go back.We had a very nice room at the back of the hotel. It was always very clean.The food was excellent & waiting staff were so good.i would recommend a stay in this great hotel

title: Fantastic family run hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights as part of a coach holiday to Lake Garda. The hotel is a family owned and run business and you can tell they really care about their guests.  Our room was one of the smaller ones, with no sofa but was still a nice size with fine bathroom and balcony. The food was absolutely amazing, way above the normal coach tour standard. The family also own a restaurant in Trento. The owner is always on the go, serving food and chatting to guests, and in actual fact does not look at all like a hotel owner - I spent a few days believing he was a waiter! The serving and bar staff are excellent, polite but very friendly, the bar man is especially funny! The hotel has 2 swimming pools; a heated indoor one and an outdoor one, both with jacuzzi. There is also a…

title: Lovely Family Run Hotel With Entertaining Staff In A Great Location
review: Hotel Piccolo Mondo (Small World) is found in the bustly town of Torbole at the North Eastern tip of Lake Garda and is in a very pleasant spot close to the lake (200 metres or so) and the array of shops and lakeside cafes. Torbole is a wind surfers paradise and also a much loved haunt for cyclists and walkers of all ages. Although surrounded by mountains the road to Riva (2km away) for instance is very flat and can be easily reached by bike or foot.   As for the hotel it’s self the photo’s in the Citalia (our tour operator) brochure do not really do this quaint little hotel justice as the pool and gardens look small and cramped when in fact it is set in a beautiful garden with plenty of sunbeds and parasols in both the pool and garden areas. We had room 104 which despite not…

title: Great in May
review: The Hotel has 4 stars they are justified the staff are great very pleasant and happy to please. The room we stayed in was at the front of the hotel which is the old part and a bit dated the food is very nice but if you are a big eater there was not a lot of it. And the price of the wine however good was very expensive  26euros for the cheapest even a bottle of water was 2.50 euros but that was the biggest down side of the place, the spa was great steam room the indoor and outdoor  pool and grounds are all very nice etc. it was all a very good standard .The rooms at the front of the Hotel are 35 m away from the main road that goes round the lake and can get very busy at time so opt  for a room in the back of the hotel which are newer and for more up to date and no traffic noises…

title: An extremely friendly hotel
review: The two of us stayed in the Hotel Piccolo Mondo as part of a tour group which was made up of a range of ages and personalities.  Not one person complained of the hotel.  This hotel is really it's staff.  They seem to interact  quite easily with the guests and work together as a great team.. They have a very friendly and efficient way.  The owner of the hotel goes out of his way to have a welcome for all.  It is a small family hotel and does not pretend to be out of it's class.  There are no tea making facilities but it is quite possible to have tea, warm milk or coffee of whatever you are having yourself at the bar after evening dinner.  We tested them all.  Good.   The bedrooms were tidied daily. Shower as per in Rome (small) but bathroom well proportioned otherwise, with…

title: Lovely hotel
review: We stayed there as my brother was getting married near by, we had 4 rooms close together, we were only there 3 nights and felt very pleased with our choice, i have a 6 month old baby so a cot was in the room when we got there, it was a large room with a sofa, the other 3 rooms were good size and had amazing views, nothing was to much for the staff, i am very picky with food and didn't want what was on the menu, i told them what i wanted and they couldn't of been more happy to get it for me. unfortunately the last day was planned to be spent by the pool but it rained so we didn't get the chance but it looked very nice, the beach is only a short walk away and the views are amazing. pricey but worth it very friendly staff and lovely hotel would return there again.

title: very good hotel, great staff - good base for outdoor activities
review: excellent hotel for food, went half board and evening meals were very good as was the breakfast. friendly and efficent staff.nice swiming pool, quiet and relaxed. great views and scenery all around the hotel and great base for walks and cycling - free bikes provided for hotel guests. only negative was facilities lacking in room like no tea and coffee making facilities and no iron but seems to be the way with hotels in italy. within walking distance to Riva which is a busier,livelier area

title: What a fantastic hotel
review: I travelled to this hotel with my two older cousins - so we were quite a wide age range to accommodate.  We had a fantastic holiday - the hotel was of a good standard comfortable and very freindly.  Please do not take any notice of the comments made by our Irish friends below - we stayed at the hotel at the same time as this group and therefore ate the same food etc.  I have to say the food served in the dining room is probably some of the best food I have eaten in a hotel dining room and it is certainly worth staying in to experience it.  We had plenty of choice - suckling pig/veal/beef/lamb/fish/ and if for any reason you do not like any of the menu choices the staff - who are very friendly and helpful - will ensure that they find you something you do like.  Nothing is too…

title: overall a good hotel to stay in
review: we went on a joe walsh escorted tour and having just come back from our stay at this hotel all i can say that it is a family run hotel. it is well run and  the owner himself goes out of his way to welcome his guests. i asked for a view of the lake or mountains when i booked but what i got was a view of a building site every morning i looked out of the window. the food was good but i would like more of a variety all that seemed to be on most evenings was pork or fish served with a sauce. some of the sauses i did not care for. i would like if they were served on the side that way if you did not like it you did not have to use it. i would have liked a bit of beef or lamb to be on the menu as a bit of variety. there is one waiter who is exellent and always in good humour and he will…

title: Not a Four Star Hotel
review: Stayed here for a week with a Joe walsh tour Group. The room I was given was looking out over a building site. It was a small room. The bathroom was tiny and the decor was very dated. There was a small TV  only showing news channels. No tea/coffee facilities were provided. I was expecting 4 star food but was verey disappointed to be offered only one menu choice for s 'gala dinner'. The only choice was pork and as I did not eat pork that ment there was nothing i could have. After remonstrating with the waiters they eventually gave me a dried out piece of trout that was inedible. The waiters were very unhelpful and unfriendly. The next morning when I came down to breakfast they told me as i was with a tour group I could not sit out on the veranda for breakfast i had to eat inside.…

title: Paradise, wonderful location, fantastic food and attentive staff
review: Just  spent the most amazing 10 days at the Piccolo Mondo with 7 friends. Celebrated my 50th which i was not looking forward to!! Everything about the holiday was perfect, The hotel was so clean, the food the best i have tasted  on holidays abroad (lots of choices and variety) and the staff so attentive. There were 8 in our party and all of us take very special memories with us. If you are looking for entertainment and late nights the Piccolo is good for a base but will not give you the night life. The bar shuts around 11.30. There are plenty of sun beds around the pool. No matter what time of day we always were able to get 8 loungers together. Guests tend to go out during the day as there is so much to do. Highlights, Malcesine, Venice and Verona.

title: Sooooo Relaxing!
review: We have just returned (partner and young daughter) from a weeks stay at the Piccolo Mondo.  It was absolutely fab.  Beautiful scenary and  great food.  The family run hotel is very welcoming, and during the evening the waiters made sure that our very fussy eater 4 year old always had something simple to eat (chips/quiche/pizza etc) whilst we dined on their 4 course a la carte meal.  I agree with one of the other reviews, the hotel swimming pool is a tad on the cold side, however, when you're in 35 degrees, its very welcoming and you get used to it.  It certainly didn't hinder my daughter's enthusiasm who was in and out of it like a fish!    There's also lots of activities to do - the hotel provides free bikes if you would like them (there are some great running and cycle…

title: Superb Service and Great Food!!!
review: We have just come back from a 5 night stay here.  The most impressive thing about this hotel is the service.  The staff were ALL so friendly, helpful, polite and professional. They really pull out all the stops for you.  The hotel is family run, and the owner makes a point of surveying everything at dinner time, making sure all is ok and asking how you are!  We were half board, and really enjoyed the variety of meals,  The menu was different each night.  It was a 4 course meal, along with any extra salad, rolls etc you may want.  The food was imaginative and very well presented.  The hotel itself is spotless!!!  They even change the mat in the lift each day to remind you what day of the week it is.  The rooms were very spacious, although there was no tea / coffee making…

title: Best Hotel Food EVER!
review: We spent 10 days at this hotel last June.  The hotel itself  is not really 4 star standard as the rooms are not very large although adequate.  Where this hotel stands FAR above any other hotel we have stayed in Europe is the food.  Breakfast is good average but the evening meals can only be described as superb! Worthy of at least a couple of Michelin stars!  And as for the Friday night Gala dinner words fail me. Five courses of superbly prepared and presented food.

title: Superb Location & Wonderful Hotel
review: We have just returned from a week at the Piccolo Mondo and had a wonderful experience.  The hotel is located on the outskirts of Torbole on the way to Riva with a lovely walk along the lake.  The hotel provides bikes with a lovely cycle track next to the hotel into the town of Arco.  Facilities at the hotel were second to none, the food was fantastic and dinner was a delight each night.  I availed of some treatments at the spa which were heaven and keenly priced.  Sergio, the owner is always on hand and staff cannot do enough for you.  I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

title: Fantastic place for Lake Garda
review: Just came back from a week's stay at this hotel with my wife and 10-year old daughter. Truely fantastic - the hotel and the location. Clearly lived up to its 4-star rating with the standard of service and facilities. It is a spar hotel so offered facilities way beyond that expected of a good place just to sleep and eat! The owner and his staff were always there to help with a professional approach to everything.  The true highlight was the food - 4 course evening meals served to your table (allocated for the week). Really great menus that explored italian dishes throughout a week's stay. We paid for half board and I would recommend this to anyone. The eating experience was a real class restaurant level.  The outdoor pool at the back was secluded, very clean and well appointed.…

title: Perfect base for your holiday in Lake Garda
review: Just returned from our second stay at Piccolo Mondo hotel. We totally enjoyed our stay as we did first time round. The whole experence was terrific. Friendly staff, very good food and very clean and comfortable rooms, lovely gardens with superb swimming pool. The property is close to the centre of Torbole but in a very quiet location.

title: Fantastic!!
review: We have just returned from a weeks holiday at the Piccolo Mondo and, while I have never filled out a review before, I felt I had to share our brilliant experience!!  The staff were so friendly, the food was amazing, and nothing was too much to ask.  The rooms were very comfortable and the views from all over the hotel were beautiful.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Good value hotel
review: Stayed for 5 nights in June in a reasonably sized room at the rear of the hotel which still had a great view to the mountains and a small balcony.  Food and service was very good with a particularly excellent choice at breakfast with the hotel owners always present making sure everything was running smoothly.  Having an indoor pool and spa in addtion to the outside pool was a bonus when the weather turned rainy.

title: Steve & Shirley
review: We arrived in Italy to find our five star hotel in Riva was overbooked, we were relocated to the 4* Piccolo Mondo in Torboli owned by Sergio and Isabella and after our initial dissapointment at being downgraded we found the hotel fine the staff well trained and well mannered, the food and wine was as good as anywhere. We only stayed a week and were sad to leave.Nothing was to much trouble . We hope to return  October 2008 for another chance to visit this beautiful area of Italy.

title: Great Lake
review: We were thrilled with this hotel and feel lucky that the agent changed us to this one at the last minute. The rooms were clean, the hotel well maintained and the majority of the staff were very attentive. We could not wait for dinner each night, a four course meal with a very varied and delicious menu. It is well positioned for the town and the outdoor swimming pool is set in a pretty garden with a backdrop of the mountains. Just mind your step in the pool as you may not notice the step - and the tiles are slippery!  Mr Chiesa was always there to keep an eye on the running of the hotel and pleased to deal with any questions.  We  would definitely return and would highly reccommend it.  Mr & Mrs R.

title: Nice but would go too a different resort and hotel next time!
review: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Piccolo Mondo, we booked this 4* hotel for my nan's 70th. We had a very nice time, I cant say the food was particually great and the hotel looks very dated. The health spa it offers in the brochure, well we couldnt find it??  The Bar prices were double that of UK pub prices.  It has a lovely location but the resort doesnt have alot too offer.  The staff are lovely for the first day and then the loose interest if you dont spend money in the bar!  I would love too go back too a different resort on the lake but wouldnt go back too this hotel. It's not 4* standard!

title: So much for the romantic Italians!!!
review: My husband and I decided to celebrate our first wedding anniversary at Lake Garda this year. We were both disappointed that this hotel did not acknowledge our first wedding anniversary, even though we told our tour company and informed the hotel staff too. So much for the Italians having the reputation as being romantic! We weren't looking for anything elaborate, a bottle of wine, some flowers or even a basket of fruit would have sufficed! But what did we get? Not as much as a grape!

title: perfect!!
review: An amazing week in Lake Garda. Beautiful scenery. fantastic bike rides in the mountain fresh air visiting lovley typical Italian villages all with their own personality and charm. Sergio runs a very lovley hotel wth attentive staff, fantastic food and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Visited Veronna and Venice which were amazing historical places to visit but lots to see near our hotel. If you fancy a lazy day then can take advantage of the saunas, indoor pool, jacuzzi and relaxation area to chill and read or people watch. We took my mother who also thoroughly enjoyed herself, so something for everyone. If you fancy a relaxing, beautiful holiday with a splash of culture and history thrown in with great food and amazing scenery,fresh air and lovley people around you…

title: Wonderful jewel on the lake
review: We would certainly recommend staying at this wonderful hotel. The location is perfect - close proximity to the town and stunning views of the mountains and lake. The staff are extremley friendly and helpful and work very hard to ensure the guests are enjoying their stay. The food is superb - four courses all cooked to an exceptionally high standard. We are certain to return.

title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff
review: My husband, son (nearly 13) and I stayed at the Piccolo Mondo Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of April. We were very warmly welcomed and had a lovely suite at the back of the hotel overlooking the pool with large corner balconies. Great to have the extra space with a teenager and the lounge area he slept in had a wide sofa bed and a door to our room which helped with privacy (needed with a young teenager in tow!). Also the suite came with robes, slippers, snacks, free minibar and use of a scooter (alhough we had a car so not necessary for us to use). Hotel bicycles are always avaiable too. The staff were really helpful, always anticipating our needs (we asked about a couple of things and were given leaflets in English, suggestions of please to visit, a translation of the…

title: Sergio's heaven
review: I have just returned from my stay in Piccolo Mondo, Torbole.  It was very enjoyable.  The staff were very nice and if I had to single one for special mention it would have to be Mohammed.  His sense of humour was second to none. The food was excellent.  It is a four star hotel with all the ambience of a family run hotel, with Sergio very much in attendance.  If I had the opportunity to change anything it would be the swimming pools.  I found the indoor one too hot to swim in and the outdoor one too cold to swim in.  On a positive note it was lovely to be in a pool chlorine free.   The gardens were splendidly  arranged.  Bicycles for the use of the clients was a special touch.   Torbole is a magnificent setting.   The lake is breathtaking.  I know I will be back to enjoy…

title: Just Loved it!
review: Travelled with Joe Walsh Tours and was based at this charming hotel. What a treat it was too. We had a very clean comfortable room at the front of the hotel overlooking the mountains.  The hotel boasts beautiful gardens, great pool area inside and out, gym, beauty salon, fabulous food and wonderful service.  It is a small family hotel and very well run by Sergio and his staff (forgive me Sergio I cannot remember your surname), the staff are excellent and nothing is too much bother for them. The hotel is child friendly too having play areas at the front and rear gardens.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: A wonderful hotel.  Large, modern and comfortable rooms.  Peacful and relaxed location 5 minutes walk from lake and restaurants.  Friendly family service.  Great food even though it only served to hotel guests.  Good facilities.
